workouts.title: SSB Good Morning Deadstop - Week 1 - Static  Monsters
notes: These are going to rotate in intensity with the deadlifts - that meaning the weeks deadlifts are lighter these will be heavier and vice versa
so this phase is going to be starting with a heavy deadstop good morning
On these its important that every rep starts as a deadstop. So once you have finished the eccentric stop and wait a good 4-5 bro seconds before starting the next rep
Start of every rep starts as the concentric - so keep the ssb on the pins. IF you have no ssb a barbell is a fine replacement, but its a little less comfortable - especially getting into position
Build to top set of 5 reps - rpe 8 - hold back a bit i imagine that this is a new movement for most of you - but we want to push load somewhat -

workouts.title: 18" Axle Deadlift - Week 1 - Static Monsters
notes: This week is more about figuring your positions out at the pulling height, rather than pushing the intensity too much.

A good tip to find your starting position is to start from the top, brace as you would for a deadlift and control the eccentric - where you mechanically finish once the bar meets the block is where you should be starting the lift from
This is going to be the only week of finding positions so please get comfortable in this position and learn quick - pay attention to where your hips are sitting
6 sets of 4 reps - adding load each set
I want a 2-3s eccentric every rep - the purpose of this is to really facilitate finding your optimal starting position

workouts.title: Block Axle Pendlay Row - Week 1 - Static Monsters
notes: Same height and set up as the axle deads above

the purpose of this is to strengthen that starting position, both physically, and proprioceptively - that being that we want you to be strong in the starting position, whilst also improving your awareness of this is where i should be starting the pull from
5 sets of 10 reps - add load each set, but really hold back will be going for a 10RM next week

workouts.title: Neutral Grip Lat Pulldown - Week 1 - Static Monsters
notes: Build to top set of 12 reps - all out - body language on these is okay, but make sure you control the eccentric and get a big stretch at the top of each rep

workouts.title: Reverse Hyper - Week 1 - Static Monsters
notes: If you dont have a reverse hyper, first of all LAMMMMMMMMMMMMMME - you can do these on a  back extension instead using DB's, just keep the same tempo
every reps 2s squeeze at the top, 4s stretch at the bottom

workouts.title: Log Press - Week 1 - Static Monsters
notes: Whatever style of pressing suits you best stick to throughout. All sessions are going to be floor to overhead. But please remember we are prepping for a 1RM - so train towards this. If a set takes 60 seconds because you are being conscious about how you are treating each rep this is fine. Don't try blitzing fast sets, and using technique wont be using on 1RM because you are trying to hit fastest set of FTOH
87.5% of projected 1RM - x 1 rep - going to be doing this 3 weeks in a row, focus is on decreasing rpe, and making them move faster
3 sets of 5 reps - FTOH - treat each rep like its own single - every rep you do is trying to replicate the 1RM attempt at end of block
rest about 3 minutes between drop off sets

workouts.title: Standing BTN Strict Press - Week 1 - Static Monsters
workouts.reps: Deadstop at the traps every rep - 2s pause here and 2s pause overhead EVERY REP
notes: 5 sets of 5 reps - add load each rep
Set 5: rpe 7 - hold back here - should feel could get about 3/4 more reps here

workouts.title: High Incline DB Bench Press - Week 1 - Static Monsters
notes: do 2 -3 warm up sets of 10-12 at a lighter load
Good full ROM reps on these please!

workouts.title: Kroc Row - Week 1 - Static Monsters
notes: pick an rpe 7 - 8 load here will be progressing loads weekly

workouts.title: Cable Rotation - Week 1 - Static Monsters
notes: Arm angle at 90 degrees for both A1) and A2)
Pick rpe 8 loads - will be mostly same load weekly here
A1) Cable Internal Rotation x 15 reps L & R 3s stretch at the bottom of every rep - try increasing rom per REP
A2) Cable External Rotation x 15 reps L & R - 3s squeeze at the top of every rep

workouts.title: Deficit Snatch Grip Deadlift - Week 1 - Static Monsters
notes: roughly 2" deficit on these doesnt need to be mad - keep it the same throughout

workouts.title: SSB Box Squat - Week 1 - Static Monsters
workouts.reps: DL stance and footwear - don't think of this as a squat - think of it as a deadlift accessory
notes: Fairly simple linear progression on these - wont be pushing them too hard - want to finish block on these at close to a volume PB on week 6 for 3 sets of 5 reps -

workouts.title: SSB FFE Split Squat - Week 1 - Static Monsters
notes: Going to be wanting to build these fairly heavy - will be dropping a rep every week -
Do these hatfield style add load each set

workouts.title: Prone Hamstring Curl - Week 1 - Static Monsters
notes: 4 sets of 12 reps - fast concentric, 1s squeeze at the top of each rep and controlled eccentric

workouts.title: Adductor Machine - Week 1 - Static Monsters
notes: hold each rep at the top for 1 second every rep

workouts.title: Med Ball Push Press - Week 1 - Static Monsters
notes: Progression comes from getting ball go higher every rep/and weekly

workouts.title: Flow State Log - Week 1 - Static Monsters
notes: This session is purely designed for skill - please treat every single rep with as much respect as you would need to treat a 1RM log - It is light but take each rep seriously
1 clean, 3 press from chest, 1 clean , 3 press from chest
so each set 2 cleans, and 6 presses

workouts.title: Banded Strict Press - Week 1 - Static Monsters
notes: On a barbell here please - from the rack
I want the band tension to add circa 10-20kg at the top - keep the same set up weekly
I want these reps to be executed really fast - i don't want any deceleration, smooth fast concentrics

workouts.title: Banded Seesaw Floor Press - Week 1 - Static Monsters
notes: I want these explosive, and you to really reach up at the top - keep the load light

workouts.title: Trap 3 Raise - Week 1 - Static Monsters
Cable External Rotation - Week 1 - Static Monsters
18" Axle Deadlift - Week 2 - Static Monsters
notes: 1 set of 5 reps at 82.5% of projected 1RM
3 more sets of 5 reps - with these drop offs again i want you to be really aware of starting positions, focussing on hip positions - control eccentric down if need to really solidify these positions
Rest as need - aim for sub 3 mins between drop off sets

workouts.title: Block Axle Pendley Row - Week 2 - Static Monsters
notes: Same height and set up as the axle deads above

the purpose of this is to strengthen that starting position, both physically, and proprioceptively - that being that we want you to be strong in the starting position, whilst also improving your awareness of this is where i should be starting the pull from

workouts.title: SSB Good Morning Deadstop - Week 2 - Static Monsters
notes: 4 sets of 5 reps - i want you getting good speed on these, but make sure that each rep is still a solid deadstop - like last week about 4-5 bro seconds before start each rep

workouts.title: Neutral Grip Lat Pulldown - Week 2 - Static Monsters
notes: 4 sets of 8 reps - body language etc still okay - but when use just make sure eccentric is controlled and still getting deep stretch at top of each rep

workouts.title: Reverse Hyper Extension - Week 2 - Static Monsters
notes: every reps 2s squeeze at the top, 4s stretch at the bottom

workouts.title: Log Press - Week 2 - Static Monsters
notes: 87.5% of projected 1RM - x 1 rep - week 2 - make this move better than last week
2 sets of 5 reps - FTOH - treat each rep like its own single - every rep you do is trying to replicate the 1RM attempt at end of block
rest about 3 minutes between drop off sets

workouts.title: Standing BTN Strict Press - Week 2 - Static Monsters
workouts.reps: Deadstop at the traps every rep - 2s pause here and 2s pause overhead EVERY REP
notes: 5 sets of 5 reps - add load each rep
Increase loads of each set from last week
Set 5: rpe 8 - still hold back this should feel like 8RM load

workouts.title: Incline DB Bench Press - Week 2 - Static Monsters
notes: do 2 -3 warm up sets of 10-12 at a lighter load
1 set of 5 reps - rpe 9 - if end up failing on rep 5 this is okay
Good full ROM reps on these please!

workouts.title: Kroc Row - Week 2 - Static Monsters

A1) Cable Internal Rotation x 15 reps L & R 3s stretch at the bottom of every rep - try increasing rom per REP
A2) Cable External Rotation x 15 reps L & R - 3s squeeze at the top of every rep

workouts.title: Neutral Grip Lat Pulldown - Week 8 - Static Monsters
notes: 3 sets of 15 reps - 1s stretch at top of every rep

workouts.title: Reverse Hyper Extension - Week 8 - Static Monsters
notes: 2 sets of 12- 20 reps- every reps 2s squeeze at the top

workouts.title: Log Press - Week 8 - Static Monsters
notes: 3 big singles here - take as long rest you need between each number - lets finish this peak strong!

workouts.title: Standing BTN Strict Press - Week 8 - Static Monsters
notes: Deadstop at the traps every rep - 2s pause here and 2s pause overhead EVERY REP

workouts.title: Incline DB Bench Press - Week 8 - Static Monsters
notes: 65% of top load from two weeks ago -

workouts.title: Kroc Row - Week 8 - Static Monsters
Cable Internal / External Rotation - Week 8 - Static Monsters
notes: Arm angle at 90 degrees for both A1) and A2)
Increase load slightly from last week
A1) Cable Internal Rotation x 12 reps L & R 3s stretch at the bottom of every rep - try increasing rom per REP
A2) Cable External Rotation x 12 reps L & R - 3s squeeze at the top of every rep

workouts.title: 18" Axle Deadlift - Week 8 - Static Monsters
notes: speed pulls - wait circa 4s between each rep

workouts.title: SSB Box Squat - Week 8 - Static Monsters
notes: DL stance and footwear - dont think of this as a squat - think of it as a deadlift accessory

workouts.title: SSB FFE Split Squat - Week 8 - Static Monsters
notes: Going to be wanting to build these fairly heavy - will be dropping a rep every week -
Do these hatfield style add load each set

workouts.title: Hamstring Curl - Week 8 - Static Monsters
notes: 2 sets of 10 reps - fast concentric, 1s squeeze at the top of each rep and controlled eccentric

workouts.title: Adductor Machine - Week 8 - Static Monsters
notes: hold each rep at the top for 1 second every rep

workouts.title: Flow State Log - Week 8 - Static Monsters
notes: This session is purely designed for skill - please treat every single rep with as much respect as you would need to treat a 1RM log - It is light but take each rep seriously

workouts.title: Banded Strict Press - Week 8 - Static Monsters
notes: On a barbell here please - from the rack
I want the band tension to add circa 10-20kg at the top - keep the same set up weekly
I want these reps to be executed really fast - i dont want any decceleration, smooth fast concentrics

workouts.title: Banded Seesaw DB Floor Press - Week 8 - Static Monsters
notes: I want these explosive, and you to really reach up at the top - keep the load light

workouts.title: Trap 3 Raise - Week 8 - Static Monsters
Cable External Rotation - Week 8 - Static Monsters
Movement Prep - Week 9 - Static Monsters
notes: For  A 2& 3 Hold DB's neutral Grip - replicating log positions
A2) DB Supine Pullover x 8 reps - 3 reps at bottom range
- lie on bench to maximise ROM -
A3) DB Prone Front Raise 8L 8R - 3s hold OH Each rep
B1) Couch Stretch w/ Row - 12L 12R - 2s hold & stretch at top and bottom of every rep
B2) BW Knee Extension x 12 reps

workouts.title: Log Press - Week 9 - Static Monsters
notes: Just because its light - dont disrespect this - make each rep PERFECT - get everything ticking over perfectly and go into this weekend feeling solid

workouts.title: 18" Axle Deadlift - Week 9 - Static Monsters
Incline DB Bench Press - Week 9 - Static Monsters
Cable External / Internal Rotation - Week 9 - Static Monsters
notes: Arm angle at 90 degrees for both A1) and A2)
A1) Cable Internal Rotation x 10 reps L & R 3s stretch at the bottom of every rep - try increasing rom per REP
A2) Cable External Rotation x 10 reps L & R - 3s squeeze at the top of every rep

workouts.title: Reverse Hyper Extension - Week 9 - Static Monsters
notes: 3 sets of 12- 20 reps- every reps 2s squeeze at the top
